alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Pawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 2:45PM CST until March 05 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE RISK THIS AFTERNOON... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 065 AND 079... The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 7 PM CST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 065 Pawnee and Fire Weather Zone 079 Edwards. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any ignitions will have the potential to burn out of control rapidly. Given the background drought conditions and very dry and dormant fuels, any outdoor burning, or any activities involving sparks or flames, are strongly discouraged Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
